official-title.#text:
To amend title 28, United States Code, to modify the
		  composition of the southern judicial district of Mississippi to improve
		  judicial efficiency, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail:
)
			 introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , is amended to read as follows:

header.#text:
Realignment of southern
			 judicial district of Mississippi

continuation-text.#text:
Court for
				the Northern Division shall be held at Jackson.

Court for
				the Southern Division shall be held at Gulfport.

Court for
				the Eastern Division shall be held at Hattiesburg.

Court for
				the Western Division shall be held at
				Natchez.

text.#text:
The southern district comprises four
				divisions.

The Northern Division comprises the
				counties of Copiah, Hinds, Holmes, Issaquena, Kemper, Lauderdale, Leake,
				Madison, Neshoba, Newton, Noxubee, Rankin, Scott, Simpson, Sharkey, Smith,
				Warren, and Yazoo.

The Southern
				Division comprises the counties of George, Greene, Hancock, Harrison, Jackson,
				Pearl River, and Stone.

The Eastern
				Division comprises the counties of Clarke, Covington, Forrest, Jasper,
				Jefferson Davis, Jones, Lamar, Lawrence, Marion, Perry, Wayne, and
				Walthall.

The Western
				Division comprises the counties of Adams, Amite, Claiborne, Franklin,
				Jefferson, Lincoln, Pike, and Wilkinson.

This Act and the
			 amendment made by this Act shall take effect on the date of the enactment of
			 this Act.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 2871 IH: To amend title 28, United States Code, to modify the composition of the southern judicial district of Mississippi to improve judicial efficiency, and for other purposes.
